meanings.definition: A person who attributes or credits something to someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: The imputers in the courtroom pointed to the real culprit.
meanings.sent2: The imputers in the office always acknowledge hard work.
meanings.sent3: The imputers at the party mistakenly credited the wrong person for the cake.
meanings.sent4: She was like an imputer of good deeds, always recognizing and praising others' efforts.
meanings.sent5: The imputers in the book club were quick to assign credit for the successful event.

meanings.definition: Those who assign responsibility or blame to others.
meanings.sent1: The imputers in the meeting were quick to point fingers.
meanings.sent2: She avoided being one of the imputers in the argument.
meanings.sent3: The imputers in the class blamed the missing homework on the dog.
meanings.sent4: He felt like an imputer of guilt, always finding someone to blame.
meanings.sent5: The imputers in the neighborhood gossip circle were always quick to assign fault.
